actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 9:00 a.m. on March 8, 2024.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Scalise moved that the House do now adjourn.

Mr. Scalise moved that the President's message be referred to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered printed as a House document (H. Doc. 118-94). Agreed to without objection.
The Speaker declared the Joint Session of the two Houses dissolved.
The House convened in Joint Session with the Senate for the purpose of receiving an address from the President of the United States on the subject of the state of the Union.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of March 7.

The Speaker announced that the House do now recess until approximately 8:35 p.m. at which time the House will meet in Joint Session with the Senate to receive a communication from the President of the United States. The next meeting is scheduled for approximately 8:35 p.m. today.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 6174 — "To improve the biodetection functions of the Department of Homeland Security, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

Considered as unfinished business. S. 206 — "To require the Commissioner of U.S. Customs and Border Protection to regularly review and update policies and manuals related to inspections at ports of entry."
Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union rises leaving H.R. 2799 as unfinished business.
On motion that the committee rise Agreed to by voice vote.
Mrs. Wagner moved that the committee rise.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Sherman amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 203
actions-list.actionItem: 223 (Roll no. 72).

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Wagner amendment; Agreed to by recorded vote: 270
actions-list.actionItem: 154 (Roll no. 71).

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Lucas amendment; Agreed to by recorded vote: 301
actions-list.actionItem: 125 (Roll no. 70).

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Huizenga amendment; Agreed to by recorded vote: 269
actions-list.actionItem: 153 (Roll no. 69).

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Lawler amendment; Agreed to by recorded vote: 278
actions-list.actionItem: 146 (Roll no. 68).
The House resolved into Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union for further consideration.
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 2799 — "To make reforms to the capital markets of the United States, and for other purposes."
The Chair announced the unfinished business was the question of agreeing to the amendments to H.R. 2799 which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 391
actions-list.actionItem: 32 (Roll no. 67).
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 3843 — "To amend title III of the Public Health Service Act to reauthorize grants to address dental workforce needs."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 251
actions-list.actionItem: 170 (Roll no. 66).

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 7511 — "To require the Secretary of Homeland Security to take into custody aliens who have been charged in the United States with theft, and for other purposes."
The Chair announced that the unfinished business was the question of passage of H.R. 7511 and the motion to suspend the rules and pass to H.R. 3843.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of March 7.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess for a period of less than 15 minutes.

At the conclusion of debate on H.R. 7511, the Chair put the question on passage of the bill and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Bishop (NC) demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 7511.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2799 and H.R. 7511. Resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 2799, under a structured rule with one hour of general debate and one motion to recommit. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 7511 under a closed rule with one hour of general debate and one motion to recommit.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 1052. H.R. 7511 — "To require the Secretary of Homeland Security to take into custody aliens who have been charged in the United States with theft, and for other purposes."

actions-list.header: Commission to Study the Potential Creation of a National Museum of Asian Pacific American History and Culture
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to section 2(b)(2) of the of the Commission to Study the Potential Creation of a National Museum of Asian Pacific American History and Culture Act (Public Law 117-140), and the order of the House of January 9, 2023, the Speaker appointed Dr. Masum Momaya, Gilberts, Illinois.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The House received a message from the Senate. The Senate agreed to H. Con. Res. 93 and passed H.R. 7454. The Senate agreed to the House amendment to S. 992.
The Chair designated Mr. Alford to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of March 7.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Michael Guest to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
